How are you doing @klonos ?

Wondering the same thing. Hey @klonos - you need to say "hi" at least a day, so we know your ok! ;-)
Hi :slight_smile: :wave: ...I'm OK guys - just under the weather a bit. Nothing to worry - seems like common cold; and even if it is COVID-19, I only have very mild (albeit annoying) symptoms.
...thanks for caring guys :hearts:
...by the way, I'm loving Zulip :heart_eyes:
you dont think too many streams. i'm thinking that

...when I checked in, there were 73 unread messages. I'm still not feeling 100%, so I just checked only a few threads and will go back to bed. I'm so relieved knowing that I can pause my going through the different chats and come back at any time :slight_smile:

@docwilmot perhaps yes, but as @StPaulTim mentioned elsewhere, these help people "mute" things they are not interested in. Makes it an opt-in rather than being an annoying opt-out. I find that good :+1:
BUT, stuff I care about happens in all streams. ?So cant mute any. Hate having to jump from stream to stream, when streams already have topics.

Sure. I think that we should revisit at some point. I think that we can move topics around (so we could consider moving them all to the main #Backdrop stream if people find that more useful / less annoying).

Perhaps when something like https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/3157 is implemented?

Pin topics to streams. 路 Issue #3157 路 zulip/zulip
After some time of being inactive on a topic it seem to disappear from our lists and becomes hard to find later. I would like to propose a feature where one can pin tasks they want to follow on the...

...last update was about 3 weeks ago:

Just an update on this -- we're closing to integrating a change that covers much of the need here, namely displaying Zulip's "stream description" features in the top-center navbar.

One could then additionally do a markdown link to a topic from that description to simulate this feature if the space available in the stream description is insufficient.
..OK, off to :zzz:
